head.title: Please Go to the Principal's Office

hedline.hl1: Please Go to the Principal's Office

abstract.p: Gregg Skinner letter says there may be a shortage of school principals (Sept 3 article), but it is an exhilarating time to be one; cartoon

block.p: There may be a national shortage of school principals, but it is an exhilarating time to be one (front page, Sept. 3). The old culture of schooling -- with teachers delivering and students receiving information -- is being transformed into a learning culture in which students inquire and generate knowledge, and teachers create conditions for such student-centered learning.

There may be a national shortage of school principals, but it is an exhilarating time to be one (front page, Sept. 3). The old culture of schooling -- with teachers delivering and students receiving information -- is being transformed into a learning culture in which students inquire and generate knowledge, and teachers create conditions for such student-centered learning.

As principals, we, too, must engage in essential inquiry to become more effective leaders and learners. ''Schooling'' now means liberating the goodness and genius of each child, with institutional structures that enhance rather than inhibit human potential.
The writer is principal of the Francis W. Parker Charter Essential School.
